{"abstract": "Vehicle sales fell for a 21st straight month, led by Nissan and Toyota, capping their worst business year in three decades. Sales of cars, trucks and buses, excluding minicars, fell 12.6 percent, to 487,738 vehicles in March from a year earlier, the Japan Automobile Dealers Association said. Nissan\u2019s sales fell 16 percent, while Toyota\u2019s dropped 12 percent. Sales of vehicles excluding minicars dropped 8.3 percent, to 3.59 million units, the lowest level in 29 years, in the 12 months ended March 31.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2007/04/03/business/worldbusiness/03fobriefs-VEHICLESALES_BRF.html", "snippet": "Vehicle sales fell for a 21st straight month, led by Nissan and Toyota, capping their worst business year in three decades. But Toyota, Ford and Chrysler all sold fewer vehicles.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2007/10/02/business/02cnd-auto.html", "snippet": "G.M.\u2019s U.S. sales were up 4 percent in September, while Honda\u2019s increased 13.8 percent. But Toyota, Ford and Chrysler all sold fewer vehicles.", "lead_paragraph": "DETROIT, Oct. 2 \u2014 Sales increased in September for General Motors and Honda but declined for other major automakers, according to figures released today.Troubles in the housing and credit markets dampened demand for vehicles last month, as they did throughout the summer, particularly in states like Florida and California where housing prices have been most volatile. The automakers said that they did not see an large uptick in sales after the Federal Reserve reduced the federal funds interest rate by a half point Sept. 18, but that it gave them more optimism for the months ahead.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "G.M. {"abstract": "An automaker whose success led rivals to cut jobs now does the same, at its Nummi plant in Fremont, Calif.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2009/08/29/business/29auto.html", "snippet": "An automaker whose success led rivals to cut jobs now does the same, at its Nummi plant in Fremont, Calif.", "lead_paragraph": "DETROIT \u0097 After years of watching rivals shutter factories and lay off workers while it prospered, Toyota now finds itself in unfamiliar territory as it prepares to close its only unionized American plant. {"abstract": "With its European sales down sharply, Toyota said it would stop making cars for short periods at plants in France and Britain.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/27/business/global/27toyota.html", "snippet": "With its European sales down sharply, Toyota said it would stop making cars for short periods at plants in France and Britain.", "lead_paragraph": "TOKYO \u2014 Toyota Motor said on Friday that it would idle three plants in France and Britain for a total of 14 days to reduce inventory amid recent recalls and a slump in European sales.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Toyota Slows Production in Europe as Sales Lag", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Toyota Slows Production in Europe as Sales Lag", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "glocations", "value": "Great Britain", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "France", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Automobiles", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Factories and Manufacturing", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corp", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2010-03-26T12:51:00+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Global Business", "byline": {"original": "By Hiroko Tabuchi", "person": [{"firstname": "Hiroko", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Tabuchi", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/061342ac-8011-5b98-896b-51ca0ac5f171", "word_count": 374, "uri": "nyt://article/061342ac-8011-5b98-896b-51ca0ac5f171"}

{"abstract": "Toyota Motor said on Friday that it would idle three plants in France and Britain to reduce inventory amid recent recalls and a slump in European sales.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/27/business/global/27bizbriefs-TOYOTACUTSPR_BRF.html", "snippet": "Toyota Motor said on Friday that it would idle three plants in France and Britain to reduce inventory amid recent recalls and a slump in European sales.", "lead_paragraph": "Toyota Motor said on Friday that it would idle three plants in France and Britain to reduce inventory amid recent recalls and a slump in European sales. The company will suspend output for four days in early April at its factory in Valenciennes, France, and for five days in May at its Burnaston and Deeside factories in Britain, according to a Toyota spokeswoman, Ririko Takeuchi. Toyota also plans to halt one of the two assembly lines at Burnaston for five days in early June, Ms. Takeuchi said. {"abstract": "Toyota\u2019s display at the New York Auto Show was a vision of normalcy as the automaker was back to its business-as-usual approach. {"abstract": "Chris Adams and Margaret Keene, a creative team, are joining the Torrance, Calif., office of Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe, as executive creative directors.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/02/22/business/media/22adnewsletter3.html", "snippet": "Chris Adams and Margaret Keene, a creative team, are joining the Torrance, Calif., office of Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe, as executive creative directors.", "lead_paragraph": "Chris Adams and Margaret Keene, a creative team, are joining the Torrance, Calif., office of Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe, as executive creative directors, overseeing the output of the 74 members of the creative department. They are assuming duties that had been handled by Mike McKay, who left to become executive creative director at the San Francisco office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group. The team had been group creative directors, working on brands like Nissan and Pedigree, at the Playa del Rey, Calif., office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of the TBWA Worldwide unit of Omnicom. The Torrance office of Saatchi & Saatchi creates campaigns for Toyota Motor Sales USA.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Accounts and People of Note in the Ad Industry", "kicker": "Webdenda", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Webdenda", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "ADVERTISING AND MARKETING", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Appointments and Executive Changes", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-02-22T17:50:12+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Media", "byline": {"original": "By The New York Times", "person": [], "organization": "The New York Times"}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/2a74f356-9f07-5691-ab0e-92083e690c08", "word_count": 1504, "uri": "nyt://article/2a74f356-9f07-5691-ab0e-92083e690c08"}

{"abstract": "The announcement that Nissan would restart production was among a handful of encouraging signs for Japan\u2019s economy in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/03/21/business/global/21yen.html", "snippet": "The announcement that Nissan would restart production was among a handful of encouraging signs for Japan\u2019s economy in the wake of the earthquake and tsunami.", "lead_paragraph": "Nissan Motor said on Sunday that it planned to restart production this week at five of its six Japanese plants that have been idled since an earthquake and tsunami pummeled the country on March 11. {"abstract": "The carmaker, whose operations have been severely disrupted since the earthquake and tsunami in Japan, said that it expects production to begin recovering sooner than forecast.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/12/business/global/12toyota.html", "snippet": "The carmaker, whose operations have been severely disrupted since the earthquake and tsunami in Japan, said that it expects production to begin recovering sooner than forecast.", "lead_paragraph": "Toyota, whose operations have been severely disrupted since the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan, said Wednesday that its quarterly profit fell 77 percent but that it expected production to begin recovering up to two months sooner than previously forecast.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "9", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "After Quake, Toyota\u2019s Profit Plummets 77%", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "After Quake, Toyota\u2019s Profit Plummets 77%", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Japan Earthquake and Tsunami (2011)", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corporation", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Automobiles", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-05-11T07:09:36+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Global Business", "byline": {"original": "By Nick Bunkley", "person": [{"firstname": "Nick", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Bunkley", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/4206976c-658f-580c-b159-4d80a57bd8d5", "word_count": 597, "uri": "nyt://article/4206976c-658f-580c-b159-4d80a57bd8d5"}

{"abstract": "Data will include retail sales and import prices for May, Kroger and Smithfield Foods will report earnings and Apple will hold its annual conference.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/11/business/economic-reports-for-the-week-of-june-11.html", "snippet": "Data will include retail sales and import prices for May, Kroger and Smithfield Foods will report earnings and Apple will hold its annual conference.", "lead_paragraph": "ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be reported this week will include import prices for May (Tuesday); retail sales for May, the Producer Price Index for May and business inventories for April (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims, the Consumer Price Index for May and the current account deficit for the first quarter (Thursday); and industrial production for May and the Thomson Reuters/University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for June (Friday).", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Economic Reports for the Week Ahead", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Looking Ahead", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Economic Conditions and Trends", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "United States Economy", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Apple Incorporated", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "News Corporation", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corporation", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2012-06-10T22:11:42+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "", "person": [], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Schedule", "_id": "nyt://article/5b3e68f7-64ba-5487-8d35-8983f2fd2f0f", "word_count": 266, "uri": "nyt://article/5b3e68f7-64ba-5487-8d35-8983f2fd2f0f"}

{"abstract": "Data will include the July unemployment report and personal income and spending for June, and companies reporting earnings will include Chrysler, General Motors and Toyota.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/30/business/economic-reports-for-the-week-of-july-30.html", "snippet": "Data will include the July unemployment report and personal income and spending for June, and companies reporting earnings will include Chrysler, General Motors and Toyota.", "lead_paragraph": "ECONOMIC REPORTS The data will include personal income and spending for June, the Standard & Poor\u2019s/Case-Shiller home price index for May and consumer confidence for July (Tuesday); A.D.P. employment for July, the I.S.M. manufacturing index for July and construction spending for June (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims and factory orders for June (Thursday); and unemployment for July and the I.S.M. service index for July (Friday).", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Economic Reports for the Week Ahead", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Looking Ahead", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Economic Conditions and Trends", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "United States Politics and Government", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2012-07-29T21:19:03+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "", "person": [], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Schedule", "_id": "nyt://article/c0397e6a-6eb0-56b4-a5e0-3794fbbf2b76", "word_count": 377, "uri": "nyt://article/c0397e6a-6eb0-56b4-a5e0-3794fbbf2b76"}

{"abstract": "Often, these kinds of activities are led by those who have been through M.B.A. programs \u2014 but M.B.A.\u2019s don\u2019t always understand how smaller companies work.", "web_url": "https://boss.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/09/24/small-business-lessons-from-harley-davidsons-turnaround/", "snippet": "Often, these kinds of activities are led by those who have been through M.B.A. programs \u2014 but M.B.A.\u2019s don\u2019t always understand how smaller companies work.", "lead_paragraph": "This weekend, I read an article in the Wall Street Journal about how Harley-Davidson turned itself around using \u201clean\u201d manufacturing strategies. Lean, or just-in-time, manufacturing is the Toyota production system, which started with W. Edwards Deming and his work with statistical quality control. Whenever I see this kind of article about a large company, I think about how the thoughts and principles can be applied to the smaller companies I work with.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Small-Business Lessons From Harley-Davidson\u2019s Turnaround", "kicker": "You're the Boss", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Business Schools", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Factories and Manufacturing", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Labor and Jobs", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Layoffs and Job Reductions", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Small Business", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Harley-Davidson Inc", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2012-09-24T20:00:21+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Entrepreneurship", "byline": {"original": "By Josh Patrick", "person": [{"firstname": "Josh", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Patrick", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/3dd201d6-98de-5767-a93d-e110bb12d064", "word_count": 484, "uri": "nyt://article/3dd201d6-98de-5767-a93d-e110bb12d064"}

{"abstract": "The platform, called Telemundo Plus, will allow advertisers to promote products in Spanish or English on NBCUniversal, Comcast and Telemundo networks.", "web_url": "https://mediadecoder.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/09/30/telemundo-media-to-offer-bilingual-approach-to-advertisers/", "snippet": "The platform, called Telemundo Plus, will allow advertisers to promote products in Spanish or English on NBCUniversal, Comcast and Telemundo networks.", "lead_paragraph": "In a move to increase its reach with both English- and Spanish-speaking Hispanic consumers, Telemundo Media will announce on Monday a new advertising platform in conjunction with Comcast Spotlight, an advertising unit of Comcast. Barbara Walters will retire in 2014, and Christopher Cuomo and Kate Bolduan will host a new CNN morning show.", "lead_paragraph": "Networks never seem to absorb lessons of lineup changes gone bad, NBC most of all, Alessandra Stanley writes. Matt Lauer, the host of NBC\u2019s \u201cToday\u201d show, who may be on the way out, was admirably suave onscreen despite reports that NBC may be seeking a new host. Mr. Lauer\u2019s problems began with his succession last year, when many viewers blamed him when his co-anchor Ann Curry was clumsily cast aside. The drama is not new. \u00a0More than 20 years ago, NBC replaced Jane Pauley with the younger Deborah Norville; that \u201cToday\u201d show shakeup became a founding fiasco of morning television, and Ms. Norville\u2019s career never recovered.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "The Breakfast Meeting: Awkwardness at NBC, and Barbara Walters\u2019 Retirement", "kicker": "Media Decoder", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Television", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Lauer, Matt", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Martin, George R R", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Walters, Barbara", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Zucker, Jeff", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "ABC INC", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "AMAZON.COM INC", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "CNN", "rank": 8, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "FX (TV Network)", "rank": 9, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Home Box Office", "rank": 10, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "National Broadcasting Co", "rank": 11, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corporation", "rank": 12, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2013-03-29T12:32:37+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Media", "byline": {"original": "By Daniel E. {"abstract": "The Japanese automaker, the largest in the world by sales, raised its full-year profit forecast even as it sold fewer vehicles.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/03/business/global/toyota-quarterly-profit-nearly-doubles.html", "snippet": "The Japanese automaker, the largest in the world by sales, raised its full-year profit forecast even as it sold fewer vehicles.", "lead_paragraph": "TOKYO \u2014 Toyota Motor, the world\u2019s largest automaker by sales, lifted its annual profit forecast on Friday after almost doubling its net income in the quarter that ended in June to 562.1 billion yen ($5.64 billion) from a year earlier, thanks to favorable exchange rates.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Weakening Yen Helps Toyota Double Its Quarterly Profit", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Weakening Yen Helps Toyota Double Its Quarterly Profit", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corporation", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "Japan", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "International Trade and World Market", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2013-08-02T10:28:49+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Global Business", "byline": {"original": "By Hiroko Tabuchi", "person": [{"firstname": "Hiroko", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Tabuchi", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/9aa9f12c-d962-5e0b-9bce-ea3da0057f8f", "word_count": 413, "uri": "nyt://article/9aa9f12c-d962-5e0b-9bce-ea3da0057f8f"}

{"abstract": "The advertisements for Lexus will run during Jimmy Fallon\u2019s taped talk show. A comedy troupe will come up with the commercials based on audience suggestions.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/09/19/business/media/live-commercials-coming-to-late-night.html", "snippet": "The advertisements for Lexus will run during Jimmy Fallon\u2019s taped talk show. {"abstract": "Chrysler is recalling 94,000 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokees because of electronic problems that could disable two safety systems.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/09/business/chrysler-and-toyota-announce-recalls.html", "snippet": "Chrysler is recalling 94,000 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokees because of electronic problems that could disable two safety systems.", "lead_paragraph": "Chrysler said it was recalling about 1.2 million Ram trucks in North America to correct problems that could result in a loss of steering, after saying earlier Friday that it will recall 94,000 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokees because of electronic problems that could disable two safety systems. Chrysler said it was aware of seven accidents involving the Rams, resulting in two injuries. The automaker estimated that 453,000 of the trucks would need repairs because the steering systems\u2019 tie rods were not aligned properly, though it said it would need to recall all 1.2 million trucks to find the flawed vehicles. Meanwhile, Toyota also said it was recalling about 3,800 of its Tacoma pickups from the 2013-14 model years because their 4-cylinder engines could be damaged and possibly stop running. ", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Chrysler and Toyota Announce Recalls", "kicker": "Business Briefing | Company News", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Chrysler And Toyota Announce Recalls ", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Automobile Safety Features and Defects", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "National Highway Traffic Safety Administration", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Chrysler Group LLC", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corporation", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Jeep Division of Chrysler", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2013-11-09T01:09:13+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Christopher Jensen", "person": [{"firstname": "Christopher", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Jensen", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Brief", "_id": "nyt://article/e8e83be1-8fda-5d26-9e3d-af462ee7d46c", "word_count": 129, "uri": "nyt://article/e8e83be1-8fda-5d26-9e3d-af462ee7d46c"}

{"abstract": "In one of the most competitive marketing seasons of the year, retailers like Lexus, Sharper Image and Kohl\u2019s are making changes to longstanding campaigns.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/15/business/media/a-shorter-selling-season-so-marketers-take-risks.html", "snippet": "In one of the most competitive marketing seasons of the year, retailers like Lexus, Sharper Image and Kohl\u2019s are making changes to longstanding campaigns.", "lead_paragraph": "THEY say the holiday season is the Super Bowl of shopping because so much of retailers\u2019 annual revenue \u2014 and profit \u2014 comes in during the run-up to Christmas. This year, marketers worried about the wobbly economy and wary of consumer sentiment are borrowing tactics from Super Bowl advertising, introducing campaigns in traditional, digital and social media {"abstract": "It\u2019s big and thirsty, but for those who can afford it, the 2014 LX 570 combines real-world off-road capability with top-end opulence.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/12/07/automobiles/the-2014-lexus-lx-570-a-behemoth-for-a-modern-age.html", "snippet": "It\u2019s big and thirsty, but for those who can afford it, the 2014 LX 570 combines real-world off-road capability with top-end opulence.", "lead_paragraph": "Car buyers who are impressed by efficiency will wince when looking at the 2014 Lexus LX 570. It weighs three tons. Power is produced by a 5.7-liter V8 that makes 383 horsepower and drinks premium-grade gasoline. During my test drive, I saw about 11 miles per gallon in easy city driving. {"abstract": "To reach its goal, Fiat must enter a partnership with an Asian automaker that would give it access to the Chinese car market, the analyst Massimo Vecchio said.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/03/business/international/fiats-challenge-is-to-improve-performance-in-italy-and-asia.html", "snippet": "To reach its goal, Fiat must enter a partnership with an Asian automaker that would give it access to the Chinese car market, the analyst Massimo Vecchio said.", "lead_paragraph": "PARIS \u2014 The Fiat boss, Sergio Marchionne, has finally won complete ownership of Chrysler and can begin trying to realize his dream of building a world-class carmaker to compete with the industry leaders Toyota, General Motors and Volkswagen. [{"abstract": "For the second year in a row, Toyota led the nation with the most vehicles recalled: nearly 5.3 million in 2013.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/04/business/toyota-is-reported-with-most-recalls-in-2013.html", "snippet": "For the second year in a row, Toyota led the nation with the most vehicles recalled: nearly 5.3 million in 2013.", "lead_paragraph": "For the second year in a row, Toyota led the nation with the most vehicles recalled: nearly 5.3 million in 2013. The cars and trucks from Toyota and its Lexus brand were among the almost 22 million vehicles recalled last year in 632 recalls, according to figures released by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. That figure compares with nearly 16.4 million vehicles recalled in 2012 and is the highest number since 2004, when recalled vehicles hit 30.8 million. The Chrysler Group ranked second, with almost 4.7 million vehicles recalled in 36 actions; and Honda and its Acura brand were third, with 15 recalls involving almost 2.8 million vehicles. {"abstract": "Toyota and other major exporters increased base monthly pay, after pressure from unions, but also in line with the government\u2019s economic growth plan.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/13/business/international/toyota-to-increase-wages-for-employees.html", "snippet": "Toyota and other major exporters increased base monthly pay, after pressure from unions, but also in line with the government\u2019s economic growth plan.", "lead_paragraph": "TOKYO \u2014 Japan\u2019s bid to revive its economy got much-needed backing Wednesday after a group of major exporters said they would raise wages for the first time in years. {"abstract": "Brad Keselowski was among the eight who will compete in the next round of Nascar\u2019s season-ending playoff; Valentino Rossi won the MotoGP race in Australia.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/21/automobiles/monday-motorsports-keselowski-wins-at-talladega.html", "snippet": "Brad Keselowski was among the eight who will compete in the next round of Nascar\u2019s season-ending playoff; Valentino Rossi won the MotoGP race in Australia.", "lead_paragraph": "Brad Keselowski won the Nascar Sprint Cup race Sunday at Talladega Superspeedway in Alabama. The victory, Keselowski\u2019s sixth of the season, gained him a berth in the next round of the season-ending playoffs, which start next week at Martinsville, Va. Matt Kenseth, who drives for Toyota, also advanced to the Eliminator Round with his runner-up finish. The top five also included Clint Bowyer, Landon Cassill and Ryan Newman.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "xlarge", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": {"abstract": "Chrysler will recall more than 228,000 vehicles because their airbags could unexpectedly inflate without a crash.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/02/03/business/jeep-cherokees-to-be-recalled-to-upgrade-airbag-software.html", "snippet": "Chrysler will recall more than 228,000 vehicles because their airbags could unexpectedly inflate without a crash.", "lead_paragraph": "Chrysler will recall more than 228,000 vehicles because their airbags could unexpectedly inflate without a crash. The company will upgrade software governing side-curtain and seat-mounted side airbags in Jeep Cherokees from the 2014-15 model years, including more than 168,000 vehicles in the United States. Chrysler engineers initiated an investigation after getting reports of \u201ca small number of inadvertent deployments involving drivers who executed extreme maneuvers.\u201d In these cases, the airbag systems, sensing potential rollovers, automatically activated. The action follows a much larger recall for inadvertent airbag deployments announced on Saturday by regulators at the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. That recall covers about 2.1 million vehicles made by Chrysler, Toyota and Honda with airbags that might suddenly deploy. {"abstract": "This week, China will report on its economy, Puerto Rico may strike a deal to restructure its debt, and Stephen Colbert will start on CBS\u2019s \u201cThe Late Show.\u201d", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/07/business/international/apple-unveils-new-products-and-stephen-colbert-returns-to-late-night.html", "snippet": "This week, China will report on its economy, Puerto Rico may strike a deal to restructure its debt, and Stephen Colbert will start on CBS\u2019s \u201cThe Late Show.\u201d", "lead_paragraph": "China reports a basket of monthly data this week that is expected to provide a clearer picture of how much its economic growth is slowing. On Tuesday, it will release trade figures for August; exports have been flat so far this year, and imports declined 15 percent in the first seven months of 2015. Other reports include inflation figures on Wednesday and industrial output, investment and retail sales on Saturday. Investors will also be watching on Monday for August data on China\u2019s foreign exchange reserves. While still the world\u2019s largest, China\u2019s reserves are expected to have declined after the surprise devaluation last month of its currency, the renminbi, which has raised concerns over capital outflows. \u2014 Neil Gough", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [{"rank": 0, "subtype": "xlarge", "caption": null, "credit": null, "type": {"abstract": "The midsize crossover category has gotten smaller with the discontinuation of the Honda Crosstour and Toyota Venza, but the new Edge remains a strong entry.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/25/automobiles/autoreviews/video-review-the-ford-edge-adds-a-touch-of-luxury.html", "snippet": "The midsize crossover category has gotten smaller with the discontinuation of the Honda Crosstour and Toyota Venza, but the new Edge remains a strong entry.", "lead_paragraph": "ONE glance at your neighbor\u2019s Chevrolet Suburban will confirm that Americans prefer roomier vehicles, so the dwindling number of midsize crossovers is puzzling. Honda Crosstour and Toyota Venza have been discontinued for lack of interest. That leaves the second-generation Ford Edge to do battle with the Sorento, Santa Fe, Murano and perhaps the raised wagon that is Outback.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "5", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Video Review: The Ford Edge Adds a Touch of Luxury", "kicker": "Driven", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "The Ford Edge Adds a Touch of Luxury", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Automobiles", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Ford Motor Co", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-09-22T18:37:53+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Automobiles", "subsection_name": "New Cars", "byline": {"original": "By Tom Voelk", "person": [{"firstname": "Tom", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Voelk", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/55da2e26-4cc4-5cd4-81d6-35a5ac0a5f85", "word_count": 524, "uri": "nyt://article/55da2e26-4cc4-5cd4-81d6-35a5ac0a5f85"}

{"abstract": "Volkswagen\u2019s unbridled ambition \u2014 aiming to triple sales in a decade and overtake top carmaker Toyota \u2014 is central to what is shaping up to be one of the great corporate scandals of the age.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/27/business/as-vw-pushed-to-be-no-1-ambitions-fueled-a-scandal.html", "snippet": "Volkswagen\u2019s unbridled ambition \u2014 aiming to triple sales in a decade and overtake top carmaker Toyota \u2014 is central to what is shaping up to be one of the great corporate scandals of the age.", "lead_paragraph": "Martin Winterkorn, Volkswagen\u2019s chief executive, took the stage four years ago at the automaker\u2019s new plant in Chattanooga, Tenn., and outlined a bold strategy. The company, he said, was in the midst of a plan to more than triple its sales in the United States in just a decade \u2014 setting it on a course to sweep by Toyota to become the world\u2019s largest {"abstract": "Toyota is recalling 198,000 more vehicles because the airbag inflater produced by Takata could rupture.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/03/03/business/toyota-recalls-almost-200000-vehicles-with-takata-airbags.html", "snippet": "Toyota is recalling 198,000 more vehicles because the airbag inflater produced by Takata could rupture.", "lead_paragraph": "Toyota is recalling 331,000 more vehicles worldwide because the airbag inflater produced by Takata could rupture, sending metal shards into the passenger compartment, the automaker said on Wednesday. The new action covers the passenger-side airbag on the 2008 Corolla and Corolla Matrix as well as the 2008-10 Lexus SC 430. The company said it was not aware of any injuries associated with the new recall. In June, the automaker recalled earlier model years of those vehicles as part of an action covering almost 1.4 million vehicles. Toyota has now recalled about 15 million vehicles worldwide because of the Takata defect. Over all, 14 automakers have recalled about 24 million vehicles for the inflaters, which have been linked to 10 deaths and more than 100 injuries.", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Toyota Adds 331,000 Vehicles to Takata Airbag Recall", "kicker": "Business Briefing", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Toyota Adds 331,000 Vehicles to Takata Airbag Recall", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Automobile Safety Features and Defects", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Jensen, Christopher", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Takata Corp", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Toyota Motor Corp", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Recalls and Bans of Products", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2016-03-03T00:37:11+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Christopher Jensen", "person": [{"firstname": "Christopher", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Jensen", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/22bae743-add3-5d3e-a44c-000d06e92aa8", "word_count": 125, "uri": "nyt://article/22bae743-add3-5d3e-a44c-000d06e92aa8"}

{"abstract": "The Fusion may not be as miserly on gasoline as the Toyota Prius, but the Ford has the handsome chiseled lines that many hybrids lack.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/28/automobiles/autoreviews/video-review-ford-fusion-hybrid-combines-savings-and-style.html", "snippet": "The Fusion may not be as miserly on gasoline as the Toyota Prius, but the Ford has the handsome chiseled lines that many hybrids lack.", "lead_paragraph": "There was a time not so very long ago when a vehicle\u2019s high fuel economy was something worth bragging about (you know who you are, Prius owners). Then gasoline became cheap and hybrids began stacking up like so much cordwood on dealership lots.
